info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:42PM PDT until July 31 at 10:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane WA
info.description:
FFWOTX
The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... The Gwen Burn Scar in... North Central Nez Perce County in north central Idaho... Southern Latah County in the panhandle of Idaho...
* Until 1045 PM PDT.
* At 842 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Gwen Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Gwen Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Gwen Burn Scar.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Juliaetta.
info.instruction: The affected areas are in and below the Gwen burn scar between Spalding and Julietta, including parts of Highways 3 and 12. High intensity rainfall on the burned area may cause flash flooding, mud slides, and rock slides. Residents and motorists in and below the Gwen burned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
